intro: Phyllorkis eublephara, commonly known as the broad-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Phyllorkis eublephara is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
